title: Occupational Therapy
shortDescription: Helps children develop daily living skills, fine motor abilities, and sensory processing.
description: Occupational therapy (OT) helps children with autism develop the skills needed for daily living and independence. OTs work on fine motor skills, sensory processing, self-care activities, handwriting, and adaptive behaviors. For children with autism, OT often addresses sensory integration challenges, helping them better process and respond to sensory information from their environment. Therapists use play-based activities and structured interventions to improve coordination, attention, and functional independence.
benefits: Improves fine motor skills for writing, buttoning, and self-care tasks
Addresses sensory processing challenges common in autism
Builds independence in daily living activities
Enhances play skills and social participation
whoCanBenefit: Those struggling with fine motor coordination
Children needing help with self-care skills
Children with difficulty transitioning between activities
